trans-unit.source: Audi A3 Sportback e-tron
Certification questions

Use this questionnaire to prepare intensively for the e-tron expert training and the associated certification. Learn about the Audi A3 Sportback e-tron using all of the available media, such as WBT and the website.
It must be pressed once to activate EV mode.
It works like the Audi drive select button; pressing once displays the current mode for a short time. Pressing a second time switches to the next mode.
On the e-tron, the Audi drive select button is replaced with the EV button.
If the charge level of the high-voltage battery is too low for purely electric operation, this button has no function.
Which of the following statements regarding the EV button are correct?
2h 15min with an industrial outlet, if the charging control unit is set to 100% charging power
1h 15min at a fast charging station
3h 45min with a household outlet
2h 15min, regardless of the kind of outlet
How long does it take to fully charge the A3 e-tron?
The ability to seat 4 is the only restriction in the interior.
The cargo floor in the luggage compartment is raised a level, and only the cargo space underneath has been lost.
With its range of up to 940 km, the A3 e-tron is also suitable for weekend getaways.
With the e-tron charging system, the vehicle can be charged using a household outlet or an industrial outlet, whether at home or on the go (e.g. at a hotel).
The Audi A3 e-tron is perfect for everyday use. Which of the following statements are true?
When EV mode is activated, the vehicle drives purely electrically, except when the driver requests too much power from the vehicle (kickdown).
The vehicle always starts in EV mode, provided that there is sufficient battery charge and the outdoor temperature is not below -10Â°C.
Auto mode is a wise choice if more than 50 km remain until the next charging opportunity.
In Auto mode, the vehicle decides independently which drive is the most efficient at a specific point in time.
Which of the following statements regarding EV and hybrid Auto mode are true?
Hybrid Hold: to save the current electric range for later use if there are no other charging opportunities
Hybrid Hold: whenever the battery is fully charged
Hybrid Charge: must be activated before the A3 e-tron is charged using an outlet
Hybrid Charge: only when the driver wants to drive electrically later (e.g. to demonstrate electric driving on arrival) and the current remaining range is insufficient
When does it make sense to use the hybrid Hold and hybrid Charge mode of the Audi A3 e-tron?
The Audi drive select settings are changed to "dynamic".
The vehicle no longer drives on electric power alone and switches to the hybrid Hold mode. The combustion engine is active during driving.
The engine and transmission behave much sportier.
In overrun, significant recuperation is felt. The vehicle does not coast.
What happens when the gear selector is moved to the "S" position?
Public charging is achieved using standard e-tron charging equipment.
The standard e-tron charging equipment can only be used for charging via household and industrial outlets, not public charging.
For public charging stations, an e-tron charging cable (mode 3) is available through Audi Genuine Parts. The cable can also be selected as an option.
Only AC charging (alternating current) is possible with the A3 e-tron. DC charging (direct current/"fast charging") is not possible.
Which of the following statements regarding public charging (e.g. at an AC charging terminal) are true for the Audi A3 e-tron?
The driver can switch between immediate charging and time-delayed charging via 2 buttons at the charging port.
The turn signals flash twice to indicate that the cable is properly connected.
The connector is locked into place via the central locking system. It is not possible to unplug the charging connector during charging.
The vehicle cannot be started while the charging connector is plugged into the charging unit of the vehicle.
The charging connector is connected to the A3 e-tron. Which of the following statements are correct?
The Toyota Prius plug-in does not match the performance of the A3 e-tron; neither in terms of sportiness nor environmental friendliness.
Despite its hybrid capabilities, the Toyota Prius plug-in only has an electric range of about 25 km.
The BMW i3 with the range extender option has a total range suitable for everyday use at the level of the A3 e-tron.
The BMW i3 has acceleration (0-100 km/h) on level with the A3 e-tron (as an electric vehicle, slightly shorter, as range extender slightly longer), but only has a top speed of 150 km/h.
Which of the following statements regarding the competitive environment of the A3 e-tron are correct?
Under high pressure, more fuel can be saved. This is the only way long range is possible.
The tank flap must be opened via a button in the driver's door.
It prevents the customer from encountering a fuel-air mixture when refueling.

The pressure tank is necessary because gaseous hydrocarbon bonds are not burned by the engine during electric operation and they are therefore selectively filtered / rinsed through the activated carbon filter before refueling.
Which of the following statements regarding the pressure tank of the Audi A3 e-tron are true?
They must be registered with myAudi.
They must have MMI navigation plus and Audi connect in the vehicle.
They must register on the Audi A3 e-tron portal.
Their mobile device must be compatible with the app.
Which are the requirements that must be met before a customer can use the Audi connect e-tron services in full?
Car washes must not be used due to the high-voltage components.
In electric mode, the vehicle moves almost silently and can hardly be heard by passers-by.
The vehicle can receive a 12 V boost (if the 12 V battery is discharged), but jump starting is not permitted!
The orange high-voltage cable must not be damaged, altered, removed or disconnected from the high-voltage system.
What is important to remember with the Audi A3 e-tron?
charging time
charging power 50% or 100% when connected to an industrial outlet
PIN to prevent unauthorized use
charging power 50% or 100% when connected to a household outlet
Which settings can the customer adjust on the charging control unit?
Charging goes much faster than with a standard household outlet.
The charging timer and preheating / cooling function can only be used when charging via an industrial outlet.
Industrial outlets are designed for a much higher sustained load than household outlets.
A mode 3 cable can also be used when charging with an industrial outlet.
What are the advantages of charging via an industrial outlet?
Audi does not offer any way to order a charging dock.

The customer can buy a charging dock via "Audi Genuine Parts and Accessories". This option may be of great interest for installation at a second location (e.g. vacation home) or for a used e-tron car buyer.
The customer can order the charging dock as an option together with the vehicle.
The customer can order a charging dock via www.audi.com/e-tron.
What options does an e-tron customer have to order a charging dock?
green electricity supply
Audi connect e-tron services
residual value guarantee
Audi charging dock
Which elements are considered part of the Audi e-tron system?
A certified electrician must verify that fast charging via DC (direct current) is possible.
An Audi Partner is legally required to arrange a home check.
A certified electrician must check the technical conditions for installation of an industrial outlet.
Audi does not generally recommend a home check.
Why is a home check at the customer necessary prior to the purchase of an e-tron vehicle?
A basic partner cannot perform any work on an e-tron vehicle.
A support partner is authorized to perform troubleshooting on the high-voltage system.
A basic partner can take in the vehicle, but is not authorized to perform e-tron-specific repair or service work.
An e-tron support partner has the necessary tools and equipment to repair and diagnose e-tron-specific components.
How does an e-tron basic partner differ from an e-tron support partner?
The most efficient way of traveling is coasting.
With the electric brake booster, the vehicle can recuperate continuously.
The strength of recuperation can be set in the MMI system.
Recuperation is stronger when the gear selector lever is in position "S".
Which of the following statements regarding efficiency and recuperation are true?
There is no active offer; only an information brochure on delivery.
I only offer the customers green electricity if they ask.
after the consultation regarding the installation offer
during the needs analysis
At what point of the sales process do I offer the customers green electricity?
The electricity is produced from renewable energy sources. Thus, there is no radioactive waste and no CO2 emissions from coal.
Green electricity suits the innovative Audi brand and its commitment to sustainability.
A vehicle without green electricity is subject to a higher motor vehicle tax.
Green electricity makes the A3 e-tron even more efficient.
What are the advantages of green electricity?
one
two
five
unlimited
How many timers can you program for battery charging (as well as preheating / cooling)?
The Audi charging dock can accommodate a 9.5 m cable.
The Audi charging dock is lockable to prevent theft of the Audi charging system.
The Audi charging dock features electrically-assisted cable winding.
The Audi charging dock has a high-quality design typical to Audi and is a secure storage area for the charging control unit and cable.
What advantages does the charging dock have for the customer?
How many kilometers do you drive on average each year?
How important is CO2-free driving to you?
Do you have a parking space or garage at your residence?
How many kilometers do you drive on average each day?
Which specific questions can be used to identify a potential e-tron customer?
the ability to configure the A3 e-tron in the online configurator from presale start
important technical data, such as the electric range
an explanation of the e-tron charging system and charging dock
a comparison with the BMW i3
Which options and information can the customer get on the official Audi e-tron website?
image
innovation: "Vorsprung durch Technik"
range requirements
corporate social responsibility
Which aspects does an A3 e-tron fleet customer value most when making a purchase?
environmental awareness
innovation, such as "silent driving"
suitability for everyday use
sportiness and efficiency without restrictions in everyday life
Which aspects does an A3 e-tron private customer value most when making a purchase?
When the vehicle identification number is entered, the service advisor can see whether the vehicle is an e-tron vehicle (information on the engine).
The service advisor may not perform direct reception for an e-tron vehicle.
Upon arrival, the service advisor must mark the vehicle as an e-tron vehicle using warning signs.
The vehicle should be fully charged prior to handover to the customer.
What must the service advisor take into consideration when receiving / returning an e-tron vehicle?
If there is damage to the high-voltage system, the emergency service worker must tow the vehicle to the nearest support partner.
The emergency service worker must have the requisite electrical training.
The emergency service worker must be a high-voltage technician.
If there is damage to the high-voltage system, the emergency service worker must conduct troubleshooting at the breakdown site.
Which points must be ensured for emergency service workers?
The benefits are similar to the mobility guarantee for a combustion engine.
Towing can be billed to the nearest Audi Partner.
If it is not possible to offer an adequate e-tron replacement car, the customer can be offered any model.
It is recommended to offer the customer an adequate e-tron replacement car as part of the "Audi for Audi" commitment.
Which of the following statements about the mobility guarantee and "Audi for Audi" are correct?
In "Guided troubleshooting".
in "Basic information on high-voltage vehicles" in the Workshop Manual
in "Workshop procedures for high-voltage vehicles"
in the "Service technology manual"
In which documents are the general processes of the Audi A3 e-tron at the workshop described?
The car has been washed.
The tire pressure has been checked.
The high-voltage battery is fully charged.
The car is parked in the parking area for high-voltage vehicles.
What must be ensured when returning the vehicle to the customer?
with iOS from version 6.0 onwards
with Android from version 2.2.3 onwards
with all currently available operating systems
only with Apple devices
With which operating systems can the smartphone app for Audi connect e-tron services be used?
Proceed following the workshop flow chart.
If the airbags or belt tensioners have been triggered, the high-voltage technician must be informed.
The vehicle is not brought into the workshop. It instead brought to the parking area for accident-damaged vehicles.
It is vital that all employees at the dealership who accept e-tron vehicles are made fully aware of the dangers.
What must be taken into consideration when an accident-damaged Audi A3 e-tron is brought into the workshop?
Electrician
Mechatronic technician
Electrically trained person
Accident coordinator
What are the minimum qualifications required to be able to work on high-voltage components on an Audi A3 e-tron?
Is the customer charging his car at home with Audi charging equipment or away from home at a public charging station?
Is the customer using an Audi charging dock?
What does the charging system display show?
Which electrician installed the outlet at the customer?
When there are charging problems, what information is helpful for troubleshooting?
a VAS tester
charging system diagnosis software
charging system of the customer
USB adapter incl. USB connection cable
What is required to reset the charging system PIN?
power and vehicle cable
display
control unit
plug-in adapter at the faceplate
Which components of an Audi e-tron charging system can be replaced by an Audi Partner if defective?
Proceed following the workshop flow chart.
There is nothing that must be considered.
The customer must turn in the vehicle via the parking area for accident-damaged or non-standard vehicles (quarantine area).
A fire extinguisher must be kept at the ready next to the vehicle.
What must be taken into consideration when an Audi A3 e-tron comes into the workshop for servicing?
Both basic partners and support partners can accept e-tron vehicles.
A basic partner transports the vehicle to the nearest support partner.
A basic partner must immediately transport the vehicle to an Audi importer.
The cost of transport is invoiced to the customer.
How is the vehicle transported in cases where the high-voltage system must be repaired?
The basic partner cannot perform troubleshooting on the high-voltage system.
The basic partner must inform the customer about the transport to a support partner.
The basic partner should refuse to accept the vehicle and send the customer to the nearest support partner.
Only the basic partner can invoice the customer.
What must be considered when a customer arrives at a basic partner and the high-voltage warning lamp is lit?
no
Yes, as an option instead of the powermeter.
Yes, in the MMI screen when the optional MMI navigation plus is installed.
Yes, a digital tachometer (revmeter) for the combustion engine can be selected via the driver information system.
Does the Audi A3 Sportback e-tron have a tachometer (revmeter)?
The vehicle charging connector is locked into place via the central locking system.
The vehicle charging connector must be locked with the vehicle key.
The LED light field on the vehicle charging port shows the current state of charge.
The current state of charge can be queried in the driver information system.
What happens if the vehicle charging connector is inserted in the charging port behind the Audi rings on the Audi A3 Sportback e-tron?
Data is exchanged via a permanently installed GSM/UMTS module (including SIM card).
Data is exchanged via an LTE module (Audi connect).
The customer needs a separate data SIM card.
Data is exchanged via the "rSAP" profile.
Which statement about the smartphone app for Audi connect e-tron services is correct?
...5 years and 100,000 km for all high-voltage components.
...5 years and 100,000 km for the high-voltage battery.
...8 years and 160,000 km for all high-voltage components.
...8 years and 160,000 km for the high-voltage battery.
The battery of the A3 e-tron has a warranty of...
average electric consumption
average speed
current electric range
vehicle condition (lights, doors, etc.)
Which functions can be displayed via the Audi connect e-tron app?
immediate start / stop of charging
immediate start / stop of heating / cooling
timer programming
locking the vehicle
Which functions can be programmed and controlled remotely via the Audi connect e-tron app?
Through its plug-in hybrid concept, the Audi is suitable for everyday use.
Both vehicles have limited comfort over long distances.
The e-tron is based on a classic vehicle concept, but differs from the conventional A3 Sportback through e-tron-specific features.
The BMW i3 has a larger luggage compartment, but at most the package has a 9 liter fuel tank and a 2-cylinder combustion engine (range extender).
What are the main similarities and differences between the Audi A3 e-tron and the BMW i3?
The high-voltage battery can be cooled down.
The combustion engine is at operating temperature.
The interior is at the desired temperature.

The electric range is not compromised through preheating / cooling to the desired temperature since the energy for this comes directly from the power outlet and not from the high-voltage battery, presuming the vehicle is connected to an outlet.
What are the benefits of preheating / cooling the A3 e-tron?
CO2 emissions 35 g/km (ECE standard, 16-inch wheels) with acceleration of 7.6 s (0-100 km/h)
top speed, purely electric 130 km/h, total 222 km/h
purely electric range up to 50 km, total range up to 940 km
system power max. 150 kW (204 hp), system torque max. 350 Nm
Through its plug-in hybrid concept, the A3 e-tron combines sportiness with efficiency and suitability for everyday use. Which of the following information is correct?
